alert.note: Alert for Abbeville; Anderson; Greenwood; Laurens; Southern Greenville; Southern Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Laurens, southeastern Greenville, southwestern Spartanburg, southeastern Anderson, Abbeville and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southeast of Greenville Downtown to 13 miles north of Abbeville to 12 miles northeast of Elberton. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Laurens, Simpsonville, Fountain Inn, Belton, Woodruff, Honea Path, Ware Shoals, Due West and Gray Court. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Abbeville; Anderson; Greenwood; Laurens; Southern Greenville; Southern Spartanburg
